content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can write a function `clean_column` to clean column names as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase the string
    str = lowercase(col)
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    str = strip(str)
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    str = replace(str, r"\s|-" => "_")
    return str
end
```

This function takes a `AbstractString` as input (`col`) and returns the cleaned version of the column name. It first lowercases the string, then strips any leading or trailing whitespace using `strip`, and finally replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores using `replace`. The regular expression `r"\s|-"` matches both whitespaces and hyphens.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```

This will return the cleaned column name "my_column".
